BTXT: Kreet Research Base
UNAM:
Hayden Wynn 
Personal Journal
January 13, 2306

I can't believe it! I got the posting!

The United Colonies Xenowarfare Division is now official. I can't even imagine the amount of red tape they had to cut through at MAST, but it's long overdue. And I get to be a part of it from the ground up.

My official title will be Associate Xenobiology Technician, and I ship out in three days. Amanda is upset, but I assured her I'll have plenty of leave, and will be back in New Atlantis all the time.

I'm still not sure where I'm going. Definitely somewhere in United Colonies space. Guess I'll find out when I get there.

BTXT: Kreet Research Base
UNAM:
Hayden Wynn 
Personal Journal
February 6, 2306

We got our first extraterrestrial candidate today, what appeared to be an alien form of leucauge venusta - essentially, a giant spider. 

Michelson, in full protective gear, attempted to attach the Neural Control Interface (NCI). Our security detail is still trying to remove him from the cocoon. And we had no choice but to put down the creature.

A minor setback. None of us expected success on the first try. 

I heard Doctor Paulson tell the others that a detachment of United Colonies Marines is scheduled to deliver another creature next Thursday.

BTXT: Kreet Research Base
UNAM:
Hayden Wynn 
Personal Journal
May 5, 2306

I'm not sure how they managed it, but the UC Marines actually managed to bring us an Ashta. 

It's not that the Ashta is a terrifying beast and natural predator (those are both exceptional and wonderful qualities, and essential to the work we're doing here). It's that the Ashta is native to the planet Akila in the Cheyenne system. Akila, home to Akila City, capital of the Freestar Collective. 

Leave it to a group of groundpounders to grab a candidate right from the enemy's backyard. Though it does beg the question - have Freestar Collective scientists managed to weaponize their greatest natural predator? If so, our timetable just got accelerated.

BTXT: Kreet Research Base
UNAM:
Hayden Wynn 
Personal Journal
May 7, 2306

Any fears that our Freestar Collective counterparts have managed to weaponize the Ashta have been completely dispelled.

After the Michelson debacle, we determined the NCI should only be attached under full sedation, so that wasn't an issue. The problems started immediately afterward. The Ashta proved incredibly resistant to synchronization, and we never achieved control fidelity beyond 47%. Doctor Chin's arm was nearly ripped off five minutes into the first trial.

In short, the Ashta simply can't be controlled. If not by us, then certainly not by the Freestar Collective.

Doctor Paulson has been in touch with Colonel Kasarov. Looks like the Marines will have another species collected and dropped off by this time next week.

BTXT: Kreet Research Base
UNAM:
Hayden Wynn 
Personal Journal
May 12, 2306

Another creature, another failure. No fault of the UC groundpounders - we wanted a predator, and they delivered. These things were SO alien, Paulson had a difficult time deciding on a designation. Opted for "Reptans Venenum."

Shame we couldn't properly sync the NCI. These things would have been spectacular. Especially the poison.

BTXT: Kreet Research Base
UNAM:
Hayden Wynn 
Personal Journal
July 6, 2306

Marines dropped another few specimens off this morning. Totally unscheduled. 

Best way to describe them? They're arthropods - the alien equivalent of Homarus Gammarus. Basically, giant space lobsters. Very promising giant space lobsters.

I'm not entirely sure where the UC grunts found these particular test subjects - some godforsaken backwater rock, I imagine. After the third or fourth unsuccessful trial, I stopped asking. None of those earlier species could be controlled with any reliability. As noted in my earlier logs, their natural aggressiveness made them effective weapons, but a bullet is less than useless if the gun keeps turning itself on the shooter.

But these new creatures possess a perfect natural disposition - non-aggressive, even docile, yet capable of defending themselves with deadly efficiency when threatened. And when they do go on the attack, they're terrifying.

So we'll see...

BTXT: Kreet Research Base
UNAM:
Hayden Wynn 
Personal Journal
August 1, 2306

We're moving! Packing up shop and transitioning the entire operation. It's happened so fast... My head is spinning.

The work on the arthropods has been so successful, we're actually relocating to their homeworld. We'll have an unlimited supply of creatures for the Xenowarfare Division.

I've been named Senior Xenobiologist. That means I'll be running the entire facility. My first instinct was to tell Amanda. I'm still not used to her not being there.

I'll give Michelson credit - the guy really went to bat for me. He let the MAST brass know that it was my work tuning the Neural Control Interface that was instrumental in controlling the arthropod.  

I guess Paulson is being forced to retire. Good riddance.

The United Colonies Xenowarfare Division is now official. I can't even imagine the amount of red tape they had to cut through at MAST, but it's long overdue. And I get to be a part of it from the ground up.

My official title will be Associate Xenobiology Technician, and I ship out in three days. Amanda is upset, but I assured her I'll have plenty of leave, and will be back in New Atlantis all the time.

I'm still not sure where I'm going. Definitely somewhere in United Colonies space. Guess I'll find out when I get there.

BTXT: Kreet Research Base
UNAM:
Hayden Wynn 
Personal Journal
February 6, 2306

We got our first extraterrestrial candidate today, what appeared to be an alien form of leucauge venusta - essentially, a giant spider. 

Michelson, in full protective gear, attempted to attach the Neural Control Interface (NCI). Our security detail is still trying to remove him from the cocoon. And we had no choice but to put down the creature.

A minor setback. None of us expected success on the first try. 

I heard Doctor Paulson tell the others that a detachment of United Colonies Marines is scheduled to deliver another creature next Thursday.

BTXT: Kreet Research Base
UNAM:
Hayden Wynn 
Personal Journal
May 5, 2306

I'm not sure how they managed it, but the UC Marines actually managed to bring us an Ashta. 

It's not that the Ashta is a terrifying beast and natural predator (those are both exceptional and wonderful qualities, and essential to the work we're doing here). It's that the Ashta is native to the planet Akila in the Cheyenne system. Akila, home to Akila City, capital of the Freestar Collective. 

Leave it to a group of groundpounders to grab a candidate right from the enemy's backyard. Though it does beg the question - have Freestar Collective scientists managed to weaponize their greatest natural predator? If so, our timetable just got accelerated.

BTXT: Kreet Research Base
UNAM:
Hayden Wynn 
Personal Journal
May 7, 2306

Any fears that our Freestar Collective counterparts have managed to weaponize the Ashta have been completely dispelled.

After the Michelson debacle, we determined the NCI should only be attached under full sedation, so that wasn't an issue. The problems started immediately afterward. The Ashta proved incredibly resistant to synchronization, and we never achieved control fidelity beyond 47%. Doctor Chin's arm was nearly ripped off five minutes into the first trial.

In short, the Ashta simply can't be controlled. If not by us, then certainly not by the Freestar Collective.

Doctor Paulson has been in touch with Colonel Kasarov. Looks like the Marines will have another species collected and dropped off by this time next week.

BTXT: Kreet Research Base
UNAM:
Hayden Wynn 
Personal Journal
May 12, 2306

Another creature, another failure. No fault of the UC groundpounders - we wanted a predator, and they delivered. These things were SO alien, Paulson had a difficult time deciding on a designation. Opted for "Reptans Venenum."

Shame we couldn't properly sync the NCI. These things would have been spectacular. Especially the poison.

BTXT: Kreet Research Base
UNAM:
Hayden Wynn 
Personal Journal
July 6, 2306

Marines dropped another few specimens off this morning. Totally unscheduled. 

Best way to describe them? They're arthropods - the alien equivalent of Homarus Gammarus. Basically, giant space lobsters. Very promising giant space lobsters.

I'm not entirely sure where the UC grunts found these particular test subjects - some godforsaken backwater rock, I imagine. After the third or fourth unsuccessful trial, I stopped asking. None of those earlier species could be controlled with any reliability. As noted in my earlier logs, their natural aggressiveness made them effective weapons, but a bullet is less than useless if the gun keeps turning itself on the shooter.

But these new creatures possess a perfect natural disposition - non-aggressive, even docile, yet capable of defending themselves with deadly efficiency when threatened. And when they do go on the attack, they're terrifying.

So we'll see...

BTXT: Kreet Research Base
UNAM:
Hayden Wynn 
Personal Journal
August 1, 2306

We're moving! Packing up shop and transitioning the entire operation. It's happened so fast... My head is spinning.

The work on the arthropods has been so successful, we're actually relocating to their homeworld. We'll have an unlimited supply of creatures for the Xenowarfare Division.

I've been named Senior Xenobiologist. That means I'll be running the entire facility. My first instinct was to tell Amanda. I'm still not used to her not being there.

I'll give Michelson credit - the guy really went to bat for me. He let the MAST brass know that it was my work tuning the Neural Control Interface that was instrumental in controlling the arthropod.  

I guess Paulson is being forced to retire. Good riddance.

BTXT: Kreet Research Base
UNAM:
Hayden Wynn 
Personal Journal
January 13, 2306

I can't believe it! I got the posting!

The United Colonies Xenowarfare Division is now official. I can't even imagine the amount of red tape they had to cut through at MAST, but it's long overdue. And I get to be a part of it from the ground up.

My official title will be Associate Xenobiology Technician, and I ship out in three days. Amanda is upset, but I assured her I'll have plenty of leave, and will be back in New Atlantis all the time.

I'm still not sure where I'm going. Definitely somewhere in United Colonies space. Guess I'll find out when I get there.

BTXT: Kreet Research Base
UNAM:
Hayden Wynn 
Personal Journal
August 1, 2306

We're moving! Packing up shop and transitioning the entire operation. It's happened so fast... My head is spinning.

The work on the arthropods has been so successful, we're actually relocating to their homeworld. We'll have an unlimited supply of creatures for the Xenowarfare Division.

I've been named Senior Xenobiologist. That means I'll be running the entire facility. My first instinct was to tell Amanda. I'm still not used to her not being there.

I'll give Michelson credit - the guy really went to bat for me. He let the MAST brass know that it was my work tuning the Neural Control Interface that was instrumental in controlling the arthropod.  

I guess Paulson is being forced to retire. Good riddance.

1. Don't piss me off. 
2. Everyone drinks. Sober? Get out.
3. Drink at your own risk.
4. No killing unless they deserve it.
5. You got a grudge? Spit it out. I'm a bartender. I don't read minds.
6. No pissing on the walls.
7. No hogging the ping pong table.
8. I pick the music.

--Bog

Credits are the lifeblood of the Fleet. Our entire operation would not exist if not for the blood, sweat, and bullets of the pirates doing the work, and the consolidation of their earnings here at the Key.

So let me make myself clear: while we have facilities outside the Key, I expect any funds outside of standard operational costs to be brought back to the Reckoner's Core. We've had incidents where Fleet members have taken over operations on various planets throughout the Settled Systems, and skimmed a little too much off the top.

Suffice to say, they paid a steep price for their lack of transparency. Make sure you don't do the same.

-- Shinya Voss, Fleet Reckoner

It doesn't matter if you think your bird is clean. When you dock, check with Jazz and her team to do a full repair, and scan your ship for any dings or bugs. 

Security on this station isn't just about the swarm of patrols we got out there, or the three large batteries orbiting the Key. It's the little things. The details. We gotta make sure to mind them.

-- Naeva

As the doctor on this ship, I just want to remind everyone of weight room etiquette. 

1. Wipe down your equipment
Bacteria grows in damp, warm areas. Wipe everything your skin touches. That includes the barbells and plates. 

2. Spotting
Let's try to avoid back injuries. If someone requests that you spot them, do it. And don't forget to ask how you want to be spotted. Some people like a little help lifting off. 

3. Rotating in
If there's no free benches, it's always good to let others rotate in between your sets. Find someone your size so you don't have to change things up. Just remember to follow rule #1.

--Samina

Looks like this rookie's finally going to see some action. Ok, well, it's not exactly that kind of action but we've been tasked with the investigation of some sort of anomaly / disturbance in a nearby sector. Seems like we'll be out there for a couple of weeks and I am looking forward to logging as much flight time as possible.

It's only been a couple of days and I've already logged more flight time than in my whole time at the academy. But wow, I've got a killer headache. Actually, everyone seems to be complaining about something. It's really strange.\n\nCaptain ran a quick systems check and nothing seemed to be out of the ordinary, but it's getting really hard to focus out here.

Last night the captain spiked a fever. He's completely out of commission. I spent the entire night puking in the latrine, and there's a whole lot of hair on my pillow that should be on my head. What the hell is going on?\n\nThe rest of us put it up to a vote and we're heading back.

MAINTENANCE ID: M-0309
DATE: April 10th, 2305
PRIORITY: URGENT

DESCRIPTION OF WORK REQUIRED:

Large section of hull damaged after collision during docking training. Replacement hull section installed. Does not appear to have affected any internal systems.

ADDITIONAL COMMENTS:

Rookie pilot was found not to be at fault.

MAINTENANCE ID: M-0326
DATE: May 07th, 2305
PRIORITY: MEDIUM

DESCRIPTION OF WORK REQUIRED:

Rad. scrubbers suspected to be faulty due to complaints of headaches and nausea among crew. Radiation levels not found to be outside of the legal limit. No further action necessary.

ADDITIONAL COMMENTS:

A follow-up inspection at the vessel's next dry dock recommended.

To: All Rangers
Subject: New syndicate in play?
From: Daniel Blake

I want you all to keep your eyes and ears open. I've been going over reports from local security both here and in Neon, and there's a disturbing trend. Seems like smuggling is on the rise in a big way, and there's more than one faction involved.

Seems like we might have a new player looking to move in. We can probably expect to see some inter-faction conflict that could spill over and put innocent lives at risk. If you learn anything that could be useful, let me know right away. Autumn's already looking into it, but leads are scarce so far.

To: All Rangers
From: Emma Wilcox
Subject: Another false alarm

Just so you all know, that report we got about the farm on Polvo turned out to be another false alarm. Local security says they headed out to take a look, and the man they talked to said nothing was wrong. Funny thing is, the original call came in from a woman and when security asked to talk to her, the man who they'd met said she went off-world to visit family. 

Normally I wouldn't think twice about it, but I'd read a similar report only a month earlier, where the call had come in from an elderly man, only local security didn't see anyone that old, and when they asked they were told he'd gone on a vacation.

Could be nothing, I know, but if anyone hears about trouble on a farm, let me know. Couldn't hurt to check it out.

To: All Rangers
From: Emma Wilcox
Subject: Good news

For those who haven't heard, we got some good news. The doc has approved Helga for limited duty on-site here at the Rock. With some luck, she'll be back in the field in a few weeks, but we want to take things slow and take all the necessary precautions. 

In the meantime, let's all give her some encouragement and support. No Ranger wants to be stuck indoors while there are people out there who need our help, but sometimes that's the way it's got to be. I know you'll all be there for her while she heals up.

To: Daniel Blake
From: Mary Cartwright
Subject: Helga's status

Marshal,

I'm happy to inform you that Helga is making good progress, and her recovery is ahead of schedule. The worst is behind her and I expect no lingering after-effects from the injury. 

However, I'm not yet ready to clear her for field duty. We're still in a window where there's a risk of aggravation, and I want her to stay in Akila City for observation, including a continuation of her daily checkups.

She seemed to take the news well, but it's clear she's eager to get back out there. A little support and encouragement from you and the other Rangers could help ease the burden.

To: Daniel Blake
From: Davis Wilson
Subject: Shaw gang activity

Marshal,

Just wanted to let you know that some of Shaw's boys are in town. They ain't caused any trouble yet, but we both know it's only a matter of time. 

One of them we ID'd as Jed Bullock, a new recruit with a penchant for drinking and doing acting up. The others who were with him, we didn't recognize, but we figured them for green based on how they follow Jed around. Seems he's the leader of the crew.

That's all I've got for now. I figured with your experience going up against the Shaw Gang, you ought to know they were around.

To: All Rangers
From: Daniel Blake
Subject: Recruiting

I know you've all heard me say it before, but the Council would really like to see us bolster our ranks, so here's my obligatory reminder to keep a look out for anyone you think might be Ranger material. There's fewer of us now than there have been since I joined up, and I don't have to tell you all that was a long damn time ago.

Fact is, the Freestar Collective ain't exactly getting safer by the day. There's always been more trouble than there's been Rangers to handle it, but that's more true now that it ever has been. We need more help, and we need it soon.
Delgado still taking rooks on a tour of that old prison? I wonder if there's still some good loot down there. I've got a cutter that will split an iceberg and I've been itching to use it.

Anyone meet that new rook, Mathis? I'd stay the hell away from him. It's nothing personal, the man puts in the work. He's just a walking black cat. Every job I've ever done with the bloke ended badly. I was there when he set up a chem deal in the same joint a squad of off duty SysDef agents decided to have breakfast. 

Street rats call him "Hex." Look the word up. It don't mean good things.

Word is Rokov's trying to get back in with the Fleet. If you ask me, we should do the old bait and switch. Get him to invite the lot of us on board, and blend us in with the crew. Then when I give the signal, we rob that boat full of rich bastards blind.
Blend in? We'd stick out like a cactus in a snowstorm.\n\nWhatever it is, let the Delgado and the new rook handle it. They can smell the rest of us poors coming from a mile away.

I worked with Captain Daiyu once. She's solid.

Now you might think I have some story to tell, because that's how it is with the Captains. Everyone's got their own little legend. But with Huan, I got nothing. Riding on the Jade Swan was the most uneventful trip of my life.

And for a smuggler, that's exactly what you want. Smooth job. No hitches.

Damn, I know the rook has been making a ton of moves for us, but just once I'd like to be given a shot at whatever Delgado's got cooking. Especially if it means heading out to Neon and hitting up the Astral Lounge.\n\nBesides, I still owe Estelle for the time she drank me under the table. I've been practicing, and no way she beats me again.

I had the weirdest dream last night. Voss was holding a big hose and credits were firing out of it. Naeva had a smile on her face. Bog handed me a stout and it tasted like actual beer. 

For the longest time I refused to believe Kryx's Legacy was real. But damn, the way people are talking, it's hard not to fantasize.

There's been rumors SysDef is gearing up for an attack. Delgado's called a bunch of pirates back to base, and even shut down the Mission Boards for everyone save the prime earners.\n\nCombined with all this talk about Kryx's Legacy, there's definitely a buzz around the station. Something big is about to go down.
WE GOT THE GODDAMN LEGACY!!!!\n\nAHAHAHSDFSDFKSKHAAAAAA!!!
Hell yeah! Drinks at the Nova tonight and every night until we die!!
Hahahahahahaha rot in hell you soulless cop bastards!!!
I don't have a complaint. I just want to let it be known Radley sucks harder than a Heatleech on a radiator.

I want to second the earlier complaint that Radley sucks. 

Who decided to let the Trade Authority on this ship anyway? I don't like that I have to see his smarmy face every time I walk to the Nova. 

I say we start a petition that he put on a mask.

The shooting range is too bloody close to the exercise area. Every time I want to lift some weights, I gotta hear gunfire blasting in me ear drums.\n\nI asked Samina for some ear plugs the other day but instead she wrote me a prescription that said "Suck it up." I gotta stop falling for that bit. Not like we have an actual pharmacy.

Jazz set up the shielding on my cargo and it worked like a charm. I was able to smuggle contraband to every major system without a hitch. My only complaint is that if my ship gets dinged in a dogfight, I gotta come back to the Key to get maintenance. I don't have a solution though, just wanted to put it out there.

Also I can confirm on the record that Radley does indeed suck.

You ever just get tired of cargo ships just giving up the goods without a fight? The Fleet's put so much fear into these fools they don't wanna tussle anymore. I'm almost tempted to go in blasting next time.

What do you expect? Do you honestly think some Deimos Hoplite is going to see you, a Crimson Fleet pirate in a combat class REAPER, and risk life, limb, and soul for a crate of Cherenkov converters? Hell naw. You're out of your mind. Just take the free credits and be thankful for it.
Is it me or are the prices at the Depot out of control? \n\nWe all know how much Aludra loves creds, and there's no way the prices are this steep outside the Key.

You want to pay the cost for grav jumping, not to mention create a freaking paper trail of your purchases, be my guest. 

I can just see the headline now, "Fleet attack, several dead. SysDef matches murder weapon to a buyer at Neon Tactical."

Don't be a dumbass. Merch here is clean, off the books. Got a problem with the prices, bring it up with Delgado.

I know everyone here is hopped up on chems, but sometimes I need something lower dose. \n\nI'm proposing we get a TerraBrew in this joint. Doesn't have to be officially franchised or anything. Just better than the slag we're drinking now.

We need someone to fill in for the doubles tournament. One of the players won their match but killed their partner and you can't play doubles by yourself.\n\nIf there's any rook out there with a good backhand and a death wish, tell Bog you want to sign up.
Does anyone else think the bomb in Shinya's chest is a bad idea? How do we know he ain't gonna blow up the whole station on a whim?

That's not how it works. It'll just blow up his insides. A mouth breather like you might get chunks of meat in your throat though, and choke to death. \n\nI don't know what the rest of you think, but I'm going to call that a net positive.
If anyone wants to do a Neon run anytime soon, that'd be aces. \n\nI like to take a hit of the ol' chasmbass before every job, and my personal stash is running low.

So I'm new to the Fleet, and I was thinking it might be good to have a get together at the Nova? Just a meet and greet so we can get to know each other better and share tricks on how to be better pirates.\n\nCaptains are welcome to attend!

You rooks are so goddamn precious, what with your tea parties and book clubs and lunchtime yoga sessions.

Y'all are so sweet I think I lost a tooth. No wait, that's not how it happened. I lost it getting my face kicked in by a Captain for screwing up a smuggling job. 

Take it from a vet. You want to make friends? Cozy up with a CombaTech Grendel over by the shooting range.

I'd kill for some Chicken Chunks right now. I would literally grab somebody's throat and choke the life out of him if it meant Chunks were my next meal. I would throw his lifeless body on the deck of a SysDef ship and tell the Captain I murdered this man if they had Chunks in their brig. I would have them toss me in some maximum security prison with no hope of parole if they had Chunks in their cafeteria. I would let them put me on death row and end my life if they guaranteed Chunks would be my last meal. I'd kill my own damn self for a bucket of Chunks.
The Captains are barely here, why should they get the best bunks? I think rooms should be first come, first serve. It's not my fault Kemp spends so much time in Cydonia.
You sure you want Adler's bunk? The bed that smells like Erdebrau and cheap aftershave?\n\nAs far as I'm concerned, that entire room needs be cordoned off with hazard signs and caution tape.

Is it true this station's like, over a hundred years old? That's older than my Jii-chan's Baa-chan. Older than my Nan's Nonna. No wonder this station is falling apart. It belongs in a goddamn museum, and here we are living in it like it's completely normal.

I can tell you're a rook because you don't know your history. This place used to be a UC facility, and we TOOK it from them. This isn't a starstation. It's a GIANT MIDDLE FINGER pointed straight at the United Colonies. \n\nI don't care if this station is held together with vacuum tape and dental floss. We ain't moving. And I'd bet my entire ship Delgado agrees.

If you're a member of the Fleet, you said the oath. Fleet over family. I feel like some people here forget that. \n\nEveryone you've ever known or loved, they come second to the Fleet. Best you forget they even exist.
The worst part is they aren't even a funny one. When I see one of their ships on patrol, I don't even laugh. I just want to pat those fools on the head and say, "there, there." They're just pathetic.
Come on, they're plenty funny. What do you call a SysDef officer who sleeps all day?\n\nUnder cover.

ITXT: Re: Re: SysDef is a joke
UNAM: This message board is supposed to be anonymous but if I find out who made that stupid undercover joke I swear to god I'll have Jazz strip your ship for parts.\n\n-- Naeva

Some background: I normally do piracy gigs. Not much of a smuggler, so I never worry about shielding my cargo.

But the other day I took my personal ship on a little cruise to New Atlantis, and the scans said I had contraband. 

A soon as I hear the words I knew I was boned. Guard over the hail tells me to jettison over the merchandise, or they'll start blasting. The thing is, I don't remember WHAT I had in there. It could've been anything. Aurora. Human organs. Mech parts. 

So I just grav jumped out of there before things got messy. But now they got my ship in their database, and I need to pay to have the ship scrubbed. The lesson is, get your cargo modules shielded. Even if you don't normally do smuggling jobs, and even if you're using your civilian transport. Because you never know.
If I'm trying to get intel from someone, is it true torture doesn't work? I've heard you put a person under duress, they'll say just about anything.
Who cares.\n\nTorture may not work, but it sure as hell is fun.
Is it just me, or has there been fewer brawls lately? There was a time when I couldn't get out of bed without stepping on somebody's missing tooth.
I don't know about that. Fewer brawls maybe, but more gunfights. \n\nI've had to dump at least a dozen bodies out the airlock in the past week.

I just want to make this clear. We're at war with SysDef. And with any war, you need creds. 

We need to build this machine up to where no army is a match for us. That means all of us pirates have to bust our asses every day to collect.

I know Voss can be a bit much, but sometimes you need someone riding you. Just a reminder that the goal is there.
I busted my ship during a job, and I don't have the money for repairs. I'm going to need somebody to float me some creds.

You kidding me, rook? You're a pirate. You need some creds? Well, there's about a thousand mobile banks just flying around the Settled Systems. I just made a huge withdrawal from the Bank of Hopetech Big Rigs last week. Stop begging for handouts and get your ass out there.

Are you some kind of idiot? I just told you, my ship is BUSTED. What do you expect me to do, grav jump with my legs?\n\nBut I tell you what, since you got so many damn creds, why don't you meet me at the Nova tonight. I'll make a full cred withdrawal from the Bank of YOU.

Just wanna say y'all better look out for me. You may be calling me a rook now, but in a few months, I'm going to own this place. All of y'all are going to answer to me. Because I'm not afraid to put in work, 24-7-365.

When y'all are sleeping, I'm hitting up them Mission Boards.

When y'all are eating, I'm hitting up them Mission Boards.

When y'all are breathing, thinking, or existing? 

Y'all already know, I'm hitting up them Mission Boards.

Okay, so I never noticed this before, but after being off the Key for about a week, the first day back I caught a whiff of it.\n\nThere's a stink somewhere. Might be a dead body. Not sure. Either that or none of you have been bathing and it's starting to get rank.

SysDef killed my partner. His Grav Drive was toast and so he gave himself up. But the Sharks didn't care. They just cracked open his ship like they were mining asteroids.\n\nI don't care what anyone says. If you get one to surrender, don't show those assholes any mercy. They won't, so why should we?

Anybody got a good recipe for Dal Makhani? I found some on ship I raided last week and I've been wanting to try it again ever since. \n\nI've got a bottle of Zinfandel Red I'm saving for the occasion. And before anyone asks, no, I'm not sharing a drop with you lowlifes.
The vending machine is broken. Before I used to be able to kick it in the right spot and get myself a Boom Pop!, but now I have to actually give it creds. This is unacceptable.

Seeing a lot of new faces around here, and I just want to remind you that we don't take kindly to bullying. Even as the lowest rung on the ladder, it's important to know your rights, and what you're entitled to. 

For example:

1. You have the right not to piss me off.
2. You have the right not to be a whiny little rook.
3. You have the right to shut your face.

Remember your rights and exercise them liberally. It just might save your life.

Okay, that's a rhetorical question. Everyone knows the grog is very high on H2O.\n\nHowever, I have a humble proposal. What if... it wasn't? Can you imagine? A signature drink unique to the Key, that would get you properly wasted. Just a thought.

Someone stole my friend Wilby.\n\nAnd since you're all pirates, every single one of you is a suspect. I need that thing to sleep so I better have it back in my bunk by tomorrow. Otherwise there will be hell to pay. HELL.

ITXT: Anyone interested in starting a band?
UNAM: We can practice on board the ships, no need to drive anyone nuts on the Key.\n\nNo offense to Bog, but might be a healthy distraction that doesn't involve drinking.
I'm having trouble telling my girlfriend I'm in the Fleet. Any advice?
Just tell her, mate. Either she's down or you're out.

We forget they're the bad ones.

Their laws are a joke. Their righteousness is a joke. They write what's right, and make us wrong.

We forget their malice. 

SysDef killed my best friend. Let him starve in some nameless UC prison, waiting for letters the guards burned.

They killed a thousand friends I'll never know, pirates whose only sin was their desire to be free.

We forget we have numbers. 

Someday we'll lead an armada of a thousand ships, and bombard their flagship with the fury of our dead.

All we have to do is remember who we are, and why we aren't them.

Something went wrong with the Grav Drive. I've never seen the Planck mapping take that long, and it was stuck in a loop until I diverted all power to the drive.

I should've realized it was busted and just ran a diagnostic, but I decided to punch through.

So instead of jumping to Sol like we planned, we landed in the middle of an asteroid field. I managed to steer us out of it, but we took some heavy damage. 

Damn. This is on me.

I had Iris do a post-mortem and analyze the grav drive system. According to her, the inferometer calibration is broken. None of the mappings are anywhere near the destination.

And that's the just for starters. Aleksy and Pete have been combing over the rest of the ship, and the news is grim. The collision with the asteroid caused a stress fracture to multiple exhaust pipes. A scan of the air quality shows high levels of ammonia and hydrogen chloride.

Some of the tools we'll need to do repairs have also been damaged, meaning our best option is to seal off the toxic areas and try to signal for help.

Haven't seen another ship pass by for days. Now we've got corrosive liquid flooding the ship on top of the gas leaks, and the cockpit is off limits. So we'll have to cross our fingers and pray someone docks with the ship.\n\nThe ship is done, no repair job can fix it now. And since a rescue's our only hope, we're going to seal ourselves in the crew quarters and wait it out.

Can you believe it, honey?! I'm coming home!

I can't wait to hold our son. I bet he looks just like me! Hopefully, he won't be a hot head like his father and go get himself injured in some war haha.

I love you and can't wait to see you.

------------

FROM: Chief of Personnel
DATE: October 14th, 2310
SUBJ: Certificate of Release From Active Duty

After having reviewed the recommendations of the Medical Board, I hereby declare Lt M. Pacheco no longer fit to serve in active duty. Therefore, it is my recommendation that he is to be honorably discharged due to medical reasons.

We thank you for your service.

Oh, Manny. You were always such a sweetheart...

But umm yeah, a couple of months ago... I kind of met someone. He works over in Neon and we sort of hit it off...

I hate to say this but after a while I really didn't think you were coming back.

------------

Can you believe it, honey?! I'm coming home!

I can't wait to hold our son. I bet he looks just like me! Hopefully, he won't be a hot head like his father and go get his arm blown off in some war haha.

I love you and can't wait to see you.
Haha, what a kidder. You are joking right? There's no way you'd ever do that to me.\n\nI'll be home soon my love. Can't wait.

Sorry Manny, but it's true. He's really great with kids, and we're thinking of starting a family of our own.

Take care of yourself.

------------

Haha, what a kidder. You are joking right? There's no way you'd ever do that to me.

I'll be home soon my love. Can't wait.
You lying, coniving, backstabbing excuse for a human! I HATE YOU and I hope you rot in hell with whatever their name is...

Remember that time I called you a lying, coniving, backstabbing excuse for a human? I really didn't mean it. Please forgive me. You have to. Take me back. I'll do whatever you want. I can change, I swear. 

PLEASE

------------

You lying, coniving, backstabbing excuse for a human! I HATE YOU and I hope you rot in hell with whatever their name is...

UNAM:
___________________________
>> Reporting Party: Guillaume, Gregoire {Dr.}
>> Category: Personnel concern, Class IV Emergency (Minor)
___________________________

Description
Dr. Guillaume was asked repeatedly to eat lunch in the designated break room, rather than at his desk (leading to at least two sample contaminations), by Dr. Walker. 

After the second (documented) sample contamination, Dr. Walker set fire to the personal effects of Dr. Guillaume, causing a small, class one fire and triggering the sprinkler system to engage and required a temporary evacuation of the research wing.

___________________________
Result
>> Dr. Walker has been issued a citation and a fine for the evacuation and endangerment of a secure facility. He has stated (loudly, multiple times) he'll be appealing.
>> Dr. Guillaume will be taking a two week remedial lab hygiene and safety course back in New Atlantis.
___________________________

___________________________
>> Reporting Party: Bellamy, Jane
>> Category: Personnel concern
___________________________

Description
On the day of the incident, Ms. Bellamy - one of our lab techs - was on leave back in Cydonia.

While at the Broken Spear bar, she was approached by Lance Corporal William Cyrus, a member of the TMD's marine detachment.

The two began fraternizing. The first of several fraternizations, apparently. 

However, upon discovering Mr. Cyrus was married, Ms. Bellamy requested a transfer. Mr. Cyrus, however, without telling Ms. Bellamy, decided he'd rather leave his wife for Ms. Bellamy, proposing - in the middle of the work day - to her.

She said "no" and reemphasized her desire for transfer to her superiors. 
___________________________
Result
>> Ms. Bellamy's request for transfer is pending.
>> Lance Corporal Cyrus has been transferred and will face appropriate disciplinary measures.
___________________________

Notation: I am suddenly reminded why I prefer to work with animals.

___________________________
>> Reporting Party: [REDACTED] 
>> Category: Unauthorized human/xenological lifeform interaction
___________________________

Description
[REDACTED] started complaining of irregular sleep patterns, disconcerting dreams, and eventually, insomnia. Offers of leave were made, but refused by [REDACTED]. 

(NOTE: This was the first error. Employee sleep patterns will need to be more closely monitored going forward and regular leave required, not offered.)

On the night of the incident, [REDACTED] asked their direct supervisor if he could take a sample from specimen M4. Authorization was granted and [REDACTED] proceeded to M4's cage.

(NOTE: Second error. Access to cages need to be multi-step authorization, not something a lone supervisor can decide.)

Upon reaching M4's cage, however, rather than properly subduing the specimen, [REDACTED] simply unlocked the cage, allowing M4 to exit. M4 walked past [REDACTED] without harming him, but, upon further progress, the biological alarm systems engaged as expected and M4 was immediately disposed of by the Marine contingent on duty. No casualties occurred (and we got very lucky).

[REDACTED] was found unconscious outside the cage door, checked for injury, and placed under arrest. 

___________________________
Result
>> [REDACTED] has been returned to New Atlantis and is currently awaiting trial for reckless endangerment.
>>> His name has been expunged from the record pending trial results.
___________________________

Notation: Terrormorph influence is an explicit, short-term affliction, not something that could allow for a multi-step plan like this. And everyone in this facility is tested for susceptibility to Terrormorph attacks. You don't get in the door if you might turn. Which means that either:

A. Due to stress and lack of sleep, [REDACTED] simply made an error when trying to collect a sample.

B. Terrormorphs are capable of far more insidious and complex influence than anyone thought possible.

Occum's Razor - the simplest explanation is usually the correct one - says it has to be the lack of sleep... but the Terrormorph didn't maul him when it got out. There wasn't a scratch on the man. Terrormorphs usually only save that kind of reverence for each other and those creatures under their sway. Regardless of explicit mental domination or not, some sort of a relationship was formed here. We'll be doing some additional investigation to see if we can't figure out what that was.

Regardless, we're putting in the above-noted safety measures so nothing like this happens again.

ITXT: The History of the Narion War
UNAM:
Beginning in 2196, the Narion War - humanity's first large-scale conflict among the stars - is remembered as a defining moment for the Settled Systems. 

As the first major conflict to make extensive use of grav jump-enabled ships, the Narion War was less defined by key space battles and more by an extended, cat-and-mouse interplay between the two powers, as the well-armed and professional UC Navy tried again and again to pin down the piecemeal but savvy Freestar fleet.

Unable to strike the killing blow, the UC resorted to ever more severe tactics to try and drive the Collective to capitulate, but without success. In fact, after many long years of war with little to show for it, even the populace of the UC itself began to turn against the cause, with protests roiling even New Atlantis, the citizenry demanding the war finally come to a humane close. So, when at long last, the final blow was struck - with the UC Navy finally cornering and obliterating the Freestar fleet in 2216 -  it was a hollow victory. 

It was from the resulting negotiations - The Treaty of Narion - that the Settled Systems as we know them today emerged, both literally and figuratively. 

Despite winning the war, the UC found themselves in an unenviable position, painted as a brutal aggressor even in their home systems. So, in the spirit of unity and lasting peace, the UC agreed to the demands of the Freestar Collective and the Narion settlers whose collusion triggered the conflict in the first place, and handed over Narion to the Collective, as they had requested at the start of hostilities (including the Clinic medical starstation), creating the Freestar Collective as we know it to this day.

In return, the UC demanded two concessions: the first was payment for damages done in the form of mineral rights on multiple worlds across the galaxy. 

The second, more significant demand was that no great faction may ever colonize more than three systems. The UC would have Alpha Centauri, Sol, and Wolf, and the Freestar Collective, Cheyenne, Volii, and Narion. 

The Freestar Collective agreed to these terms, creating - and codifying into law - the Settled Systems as we know them today. The Treaty of Narion has since become the foundation of all contemporary political relations, and it's only official violation, the cause of the galaxy's greatest conflict - the Colony War.

To learn more about the Colony War, please proceed to the "Conflict Among the Stars" mural.

This public terminal is available for your use! 

All entries made here will be visible to other travelers who come through the colony. If you have extra goods to sell or warnings to offer other merchants, please feel free to enter them here. 

Several colonies throughout the Settled Systems are participating in this program. Our goal is to make the spacelanes a safer for traveling merchants, and give you all a way to stay in touch. Please spread the word at any new colonies you encounter! 

Good luck out there!

Your friends at the colony of Bluebonnet

Hello, fellow travelers!

My name's Oren. I'm a long-hauler for Dogstar. My ship's always stocked with extra components for travelers in need. I sell in the spacelanes, and I also work with vendors at Nekoville, Bluebonnet, and Lucky Day. Mention this terminal entry for a discount. 

Keep an eye out for my ship, "Merryweather", if you're traveling in the area. I'm always looking for new customers.

Oren

Looking for a change of scenery? Consolidated Mining is always hiring! 

Miners earn a generous base wage, with bonuses available based on performance and the value of any resources mined at their site. 

Inquire about your next big opportunity with one of our traveling recruiters, or hop a ship to any major Settlement and find us there. We can't wait to meet you!

Luna,

This is Carlie Banner, the traveling nurse you met in Cydonia. You left your sketchbook at the bar! I'm sure you want it back, everything in there is gorgeous. I'm holding onto it for now so nothing happens to it. 

It sounds like we usually travel the same routes, so I'm leaving messages for you wherever I can! My next stop is Lucky Day, then I'm headed to New Homestead to resupply. Hope to meet up soon. I'll keep your gorgeous portraits safe and sound in the meantime.

Cheers,

Carlie

ATTENTION ALL TRAVELERS!!

I've seen a big jump in the number of Va'ruun Zealot ships around Bluebonntet lately! If you see them, GET AWAY! You won't beat them in a fight, and they don't want to trade with us. For everybody's sake, don't tick them off!

PLEASE STAY SAFE!!!!!!

Junyi Chin, Bluebonnet resident

BTXT:
General
----------
Status: Active
Project Leader: Dr. Marsha Penberry
Lab Assignment: Engineering Bay 2, Lab #1
UNAM:
The goal of Project UCE-85 (Svalinn) is to create "smart" shielding designed to offer better efficiency and power economy for larger starships.

Rather than generate shield power for all modules, the intelligent shielding would divert power on the fly based on predictive algorithms, taking advantage of data rooted in classical Bayesian Inference and Time Series Modeling.

By calculating a number of high probability factors such as distance, enemy ship capabiltiies, and likely targets, the system would anticipate and generate shielding for specific modules before an attack occurs, rather than rely on "in the moment" computations that are too slow to be practical.

Benefits:
   -- Better, more concentrated shielding
   -- More efficient energy consumption
   -- Increased power supply for other systems

UNAM:
The goal of Project UCA-44 (Teucer) is to create a guided missile targeting system that offers surgical ballistic damage to enemy spacecrafts.

The use case for the system is to debilitate targets without destroying the ships themselves.

Benefits:
   -- Disabling enemy spacecraft without harming systems or crew, allowing for better recovery of resources and prisoners.
   -- More efficient use of weapons increasing overall cost effectiveness

When it comes to the Well, there's no other word for it but Dickensian. How the United Colonies continues to let this space fester and grow is beyond my comprehension. Do they not understand that its existence is like an infection that becomes gangrenous with time?

The entire area is full of vandals, extortionists, and petty thieves. As far as I'm concerned, UC Security needs to take a hard, zero tolerance policy and start arresting them all en masse.

The other day some Well rat picked my pocket. It was just as I was leaving the NAT. He had his head down and bumped into me as he was making his way down the ramp, It wasn't until I reached my desk that I realized what happened. To think, I actually apologized to the thief!\n\nI reported the crime immediately to Sergeant Yumi, but he seemed reluctant to bring UC Security down into the Well. Apparently my description was too vague. I suggested he simply arrested them all as a joke, but he didn't find it particularly funny.

Since Sergeant Yumi doesn't have the resources to investigate the crimes in the Well, I've taken it upon myself to visit Aegis and see if I can't find a record of the miscreant in the civilian database.\n\nIt took longer than was comfortable, but I think I found a match. A young man, employed as a cargo hauler, and previously served time for vandalism, but escaped jail time due to a medical condition. Tahir Vala.

Patient: Emily Lisken

Patient suffered a fall while out touring the icy crags south of New Homestead. Patent was airlifted here with injuries to both legs. Fractured two metatarsals on left foot. Treated and set the wounds. Prescribed extra-strength painkillers and called it a day.

Patient: Jasirra Tommason\n\nMrs. Tommason came in complaining of acute frostbite. Turns out she was just very cold. Prescribed hot cocoa and told her to stay outside if she can't tell the difference between being cold and actual frostbite.

Patient: Marco Wendt\n\nMarco thought it would be a good idea to sneak into the Methane Plant by himself instead of sticking to the tour. Almost asphyxiated on Methane, and had to be given oxygen. He'll live.

Patient: Terry Glasgow\n\nTerry is a local, one of my regulars. Normally, Terry is a bit of a hypochondriac, but this was just a regular yearly physical. No abnormalities. Bloodwork looks mostly good. LDL cholesterol is a little high. Needs to cut down on fatty foods and exercise more.

Patient: Piera Kowalczyk\n\nTreated 2nd degree burns from leaning on a steam pipe on mid brachium. Claimed she was just trying to get warm. Learned a lesson. Instructed her to apply antibacterial/anti-inflammatory balm 3/day and keep the burn wrapped.

Got the situation under control, Captain! Turns out there was a slight misalignment in engine bay 6 causing all that rumbling. We were able to scrounge up some scrap metal and secure it. Luckily, Zuska was small enough to climb in there to weld it in place, else we would have had to rip up the lavatories to get at it, and I know that wouldn't have sat well with anyone on board. But anyway. Job's done and hey, no more shaking!\n\n-Amin

> I'm out of ideas. 
> The first few ships we saw when we arrived were quick to divert away from us. The one 
> that stopped and seemed to want to communicate with us left after attempts failed. 
> Yue  said the signal came through all garbled. It could be whatever language the 
> creatures speak, or it could be an incompatibility with our comm systems. Yue isn't 
> sure. Amin has no idea. If we still had the landing craft, we could just ventured down
> ourselves. We even tried something called "morse code" that Julia suggested out of 
> an old book. It's basically a message conveyed by flashing our lights on and off at 
> various intervals, but either they aren't able to decode it, or worse, no one's even 
> looking. I could use your counsel.
>
> -Captain Diana Brackenridge

I believe our best course of action is to remain here and keep waiting. Whoever or whatever they are, they're bound to attempt a docking procedure with us at some point. They may be equally worried. I recommend preparing a select welcoming party. When it occurs, we should be careful, but welcoming. You've done a wonderful job briefing the crew and maintaining order. Keep at it. We will get through this.

-Mabhuti

ITXT: RE: Urgent Message from the Captain
UNAM:
> Beloved crew of the ECS Constant,
> First, the excellent news. We have arrived at New Jamestown! The mission our forebears 
> initiated hundreds of years ago is a resounding success!
> 
> However, with no landing craft, we remain stuck in orbit. The plan was always to 
> dismantle parts of the Constant once we arrived in orbit, and attempt to construct a 
> new landing craft. However, we have also learned that the planet appears inhabited. 
> Before we jump to conclusions, we cannot say with certainty this is alien life. So far, 
> efforts to communicate have not succeeded. Our goal is now to attempt to meet with 
> them and arrange transport, rather than risk undue damage to our current home. 
> Then, we can negotiate our rights to the planet. Thank you for remaining calm in these
> uncertain times.
>
> -Captain Diana Brackenridge

Aliens!! Oh my god! Diana! You never said aliens could ever be a possibility! What do we do? I'm hyperventilating over here! They're not hostile, are they? What are we going to do? What do I tell people? They're all asking, and I don't know what to say! A little help, please!

-Abe

I just wanted to let you know that we've gone through the last of the freeze-dried strawberries.  Some of the crew have been pressuring me to open up the seed vault so Janet can plant more, but I had to tell them I can't. Even if I wanted to, there's the risk we'd lose more than just strawberries. I figure it's worth mentioning just in case people get desperate.\n\n-Daisuke
I went over your bloodwork. Take more vitamin D. Another half a pill a day should be sufficient. That's it.\n\n-Lorelei

Make sure you put this on your task list.\n\nWe need to recalibrate the Model A so that its signal reaches about a kilometer longer. We have been getting more meteorite impacts further out so it would be useful to get more samples.

[Incoming Message]

It seems like we haven't been getting as many tests done as previous months. Can you guys give me some insight on why we're slowing down so much?


[Outgoing Message]

The forecast data keeps telling us impacts are happening at a more frequent rate throughout the day. Although the data can be pretty inconsistent, we are just following protocol. If it continues to be spotty maybe we'll risk it. I mean, what are the odds of being struck by a meteor.

Hello!

Welcome to the city of New Atlantis, capital of the United Colonies, and for many, the Settled Systems as a whole. You stand now in the most technologically advanced city the human race has ever conceived and constructed. 

New Atlantis was founded in the year 2156, the same year we first arrived in the Alpha Centauri star system. If you're a resident, then you're already familiar with your fantastic home! And if you're a visitor, you are an honored guest of the United Colonies, and will be treated as such. 

Our courteous and professional Security personnel can be found all over the city, and it's their job to ensure your time in New Atlantis is joyful, lawful, and productive.

So as you stroll the streets, or take the NAT train to the city's different districts, know that you are in the embrace of the United Colonies, and couldn't be in better hands.

We are the children of Earth.

The United Colonies as an entity was first established in the year 2159, on the planet Earth, as a means of unifying the human race as we spread amongst the stars. Our goal was the peaceful exploration and colonization of space, working in harmony with anyone who wished to sail forth across the blackest sea, to new horizons. In 2161, we issued the Centaurus Proclamation, which formalized the colonization of distant worlds for anyone who wished to do so.

Unfortunately, not everyone shared in our dream. When wars erupted across the Settled Systems, the United Colonies stood steadfast, protecting humans and their right to fairly colonize.

And then, when our beloved home world was rendered uninhabitable in the year 2203, the United Colonies knew it had a sacred responsibility - we were to be the keepers of Earth. Its artifacts. Its ideals. Its cultures. Its very people.

So while you stand now on the planet Jemison, in the city of New Atlantis, in the Alpha Centauri star system, know that for all intents and purposes, you are still very much on Earth. 

And Earth takes care of its own.

Here in New Atlantis, a citizen or visitor can find just about any service they may need. From freshly brewed coffee to complete body reconstruction, we have it all!

The following is a list of corporations and businesses that have found a home in New Atlantis. (District location is indicated in parentheses.)

- TerraBrew Coffee (Spaceport, Commercial)
- Jemison Mercantile (Spaceport)
- The Viewport Tavern (Spaceport)
- Centurion Arsenal (Residential)
- Reliant Medical - (Residential)
- Enhance! (Commercial)
- Chunks (Residential)
- CJ's (Residential)
- EIT Clothier (Residential) 
- Outland (Commercial)
- Jake's (The Well)
- Apex Electronics (The Well)

Here in New Atlantis, you'll find a wide variety of buildings that provide various functions and services. They include:

	GalBank (Commercial)
	SSNN (Commercial) 
	The Trade Authority (The Well)
	Sanctum Universum Church (MAST)
	House of Enlightenment (The Well)
	Freestar Collective Embassy (MAST)
	House Va'ruun Embassy (MAST)
	Infinity LTD Corporate Headquarters (Commercial)
	MedBay (The Well)
	UC Surplus (The Well)

It's impossible to visit New Atlantis and not notice the imposing structure that is MAST. Much more than a building, MAST also serves as the very foundation of the United Colonies. There, the Military, Administrative and Scientific Triumverate works tirelessly to ensure continuing peace and prosperity for everyone under the UC's protection.\n\n

The foundation of any society is its people, and there is no stronger person than a United Colonies citizen. As a citizen, you will carry a status unequaled in the Settled Systems, and will be recognized as the truly special individual you are. Whether you make your home in New Atlantis, Cydonia, or any other officially recognized settlement, citizenship is the truest badge of loyalty and dedication to the United Colonies you can possess.
As a United Colonies citizen, you will be afforded the following privileges:

* An exclusive and personalized acknowledgement of your new status
* A welcome letter signed by none other than President Alexandra Abello herself 
* Discounts at all major United Colonies business establishments
* Exclusive access to home ownership in New Atlantis
* A one-time credit disbursement
* And more!

How does one become a citizen? It's easy! Simply serve the United Colonies in any official capacity, and once you've met the allotted requirements, citizenship will be granted. 
 
Currently, the fastest and simplest way to achieve citizenship is to complete a tour of duty in the Vanguard, the United Colonies' very own volunteer fleet. So if you've got your own ship, and the moxie to put yourself in harm's way for the good of the UC, speak with Commander John Tuala in MAST and get signed up today!
 
Note that as of this time, the United Colonies offers citizenship to anyone within the Settled Systems, regardless of current address or faction affiliation. If you want the United Colonies, the United Colonies wants you!

I find it so strange that I'm nostalgic for a time I never experienced, but that's how I feel whenever I pick up a tome of ancient Earth literature. In particular, the works of Charles Dickens.

These places, these worlds... whether they existed or not, they fill me with a sense of longing.

Perhaps it's because the plight that ails the characters in his novels mirrors that which exist in our world. 

I had one such book arrive today, A Tale of Two Cities. For whatever reason, I just can't put it down. Maybe it's because it reminds me of the situation here. You could argue the Well and the Residential District are two separate cities of their own. Of course, if I had my way, the Well would not exist. For New Atlantis to stand, the other must fall.

I was at the tram station minding my own business when I saw the vandal, Tahir Vala, try to spray paint one of the signs. I immediately recognized Mr. Vala from a prior incident, and called for security. Perhaps that was my mistake.

Alerted by my call, he quickly darted toward the tram, and the doors closed before I could catch him.

Regardless, he can't hide from UC Security any longer. I'll be putting a call to Sergeant Yumi immediately to have a squad dispatched to Kay's House in the Well. I'll also provide a full statement as soon as I have a moment.

Suspect: Tahir Vala
Occupation: Cargo Hauler
Hair: Black
Eyes: Brown
Weight: 80 kg (Approximation)
Height: 1.8 meters
Location: Residence unknown, but often spends time at Kay's in the Well

I could pass this information to Sergeant Yumi, but given his previous reluctance, I'm not sure anything would come of it. However, I will keep this information on file in the event other reports of criminal activity come in. Recidivism in the Well is high, and it's only a matter of time before Mr. Vala strikes again. When it happens, I'll be the first to contact UC Security and let them know who's at fault.
Canyon rocks make approach vector bad for supply ships, so constructing a bridge to reach the target site. We'll start packing it up once automated facilities are further online.
Establish perimeter patrols for the bots. The less time we have personnel outside, the better.
Ultraviolet Protocols in effect on this area. No one goes inside.

There was no mention of this cave in the brief. There's structures in there, commander. Manmade, or, I don't know, ALIEN-MADE. I've lost two recon teams and one rescue team. None of them made it. We can't even risk trying to retrieve the bodies.\n\nI'm sealing off this site per Ultraviolet Protocols. You need to get a courier to the client IMMEDIATELY. There's no way this is a coincidence.

The assembly lines are coming along at a good clip. But requiring only Omega Class personnel effectively means our sworn-to-secrecy grunts are doing all the manual work, instead of subcontracted techs. I'm not paid to ask questions, but it's a LOT of credits to burn, so I hope whoever is footing the bill is happy about this, because if it were me, I'd just buy a private resort and sip Chandra Pinot Noir all day.

-Model A Robots, modified trim
-Short Range Turrets
-Make sure to link all remote operations to the master computer in the supervisor's overlook room
Unidentified ship incoming! No known faction markings. Everyone take up defensive positions. Now! Now!
Outer garrison has fallen. Hostiles have no known profile. Tier-1 threat! Repeat. Tier-1 Threat! Lock down the base!

Secure target site. Construct defensive fortifications (Omega Class). Full automated defenses plus garrison and associated equipment. Automated manufacturing facilities to make site self-sustaining and requiring minimal supply drops.

Absolutely no conjecture about the client will be tolerated. Establish black site rules and security rundown with all garrison operatives. No one to go outside the established fortification area. These people are paying for the full package, folks. Let's show them what hiring Ecliptic means.

-Materials for landing site with ability to land periodic supply drops
-Reinforced materials and prefabs for operation site
-Excavation equipment
-Loaders and transports
-Elevators
-Automated manufacturing equipment

May 6th, 2330

Sent around the usual message to the others about recruiting. I hate to nag, but I don't know what else to do. We're way below where I'd like us to be, and if there really is another smuggling syndicate setting up shop in the Freestar Collective, we're going to be spread dangerously thin.

At this point, I'm ready to accept any halfway decent candidate who walks into the Rock. Emma's got an eye for talent, and I trust her to weed out anyone that's unfit. If it gets the Council off my back, I ain't going to complain.

May 3rd, 2330

I'm starting to worry about Autumn. As much as I'd like to deny it, Emma might be right. Maybe tracking down that new smuggling syndicate we've been getting reports about was too big an assignment. She's young, headstrong and ain't the best at keeping in touch while she's out in the field, so the long silence might mean she's in some kind of trouble.

For now, I'm going to sit tight and hope we get some kind of word soon. Emma always says we've got to have faith in the people we give a badge to, so for now I'll stay the course. But if another week goes by without news, I might need to send someone out to track her down.

I ain't much for superstition or luck, but I'll cross my fingers anyway.

May 1st, 2330

Seems like every time I get a slate from one of the Governors, they've just got to bring up retirement. "We ain't trying to push you into it," they all say, "we're just looking to the future. Got to be prepared, after all!" 

Feels like I've read some version of that a half dozen times in the past month alone. 

I've got no illusions that I'm the best Marshal the Rangers ever had, but damn, am I doing such a bad job that they want me gone? Or is it something else? No way I'd believe Emma would go around behind my back and talk to the Council. She jokes about it, sure, but I trust her like family.

What would I even do, anyway? Am I supposed to set up some farm on my own and while away my last days watching the crops grow until the sun goes down? To hell with that. Truth is, I live for the job and nothing else. When I can't do that anymore, I'll hang up my spurs. The Governors can wait.

Ansalaga, Marina

Trident Operations Manual SOTS-02-21.28

In the event of a ship-wide lockdown, the Purser on duty will lock their computer, and report to their mustering location on A Deck. Any passenger with a valid Claim ID will still be able to access their goods through the auto-retrieval system. Once the lockdown has been canceled, the Purser on duty will return to their normal posting and continue to assist passengers until port-of-call arrival.

In the event that the vessel has been attacked either internally or externally, the magnetic seal will be activated on the safe and access will be fully restricted. Any passenger with a valid Claim ID will have to wait until the ship's alert has been canceled to access their goods.

Trident Operations Manual SOTS-03-11.02

Once a valuable is stored in the Purser's safe, the passenger is to be issued a Claim ID (Supply Code TCL-0808A) that will allow them to access their valuables at any time. Note that the Claim ID will use the safe's internal compartmentalization system to only allow access to the passenger's specific valuables.

In the unlikely event that the safe becomes overloaded, please apologize to the passenger, and tell them that they are welcome to use the safe located in their cabin to store their goods. Note down their name and contact that passenger if any Claim ID's are returned.

This public terminal is available for your use! 

All entries made here will be visible to other travelers who come through the colony. If you have extra goods to sell or warnings to offer other merchants, please feel free to enter them here. 

Several colonies throughout the Settled Systems are participating in this program. Our goal is to make the spacelanes a safer for traveling merchants, and give you all a way to stay in touch. Please spread the word at any new colonies you encounter! 

Good luck out there!

Your friends at the colony of Nekoville

Just seeing who's out there! Add your name, your ship's name, and a brief description of what you do to the list, so we can get to know each other. See you all in the spacelanes! 

Perry Trace - Sailor's Delight - Traveling engineer who services independent colonies

Ludi Yang - Sweet Dream IV - Traveling saleswoman for Boom Pop! Try our new flavors today! 

Nadia Hertzeg - Moonflower - Adventurer at large. Find me among the stars! 

Luna Wright - Latitude - Official resort painter for Paradiso

Jio Osaka - Mother's Tongue - Traveling vendor specializing in organic goods

Andromeda Kepler - Leonardo da Vinci - Writer, philosopher, admirer of the universe. Be well.

Rakhil Sohman -  Earth's Bounty - Recruiter for Consolidated Mining. Join up today! 

Elliot Vane - Martian Moon - Geological Surveyor for Six Sisters Mining. Hello, galaxy! 

Omar Nevin - Gravitas - Traveling food and wine vendor. Good to see you on this list, Jio!

Hi all,

My name's Perry Trace. I'm a former MAST engineer who got sick of life in the big city and struck out on my own. I make an annual circuit between all the minor colonies in the nearby systems repairing robots and doing general engineering work. 

Lately, I've noticed a lot of travelers in outdated ships that need repairs. It seems like high-end fixes are beyond most people's means, and it's putting a lot of you at risk. So starting now, I'm offering to fix your ship for FREE! Any traveler in need can find me along my route and get any repairs done at no cost. Please don't hesitate to reach out if you're in need! 

Best of luck, and safe travels

Dr. Perry

Omar Nevin here, with the best news you've heard all day! Chandra Vineyards overstocked my hull, so I have wine to sell for cheap. Classy stuff, too. Good enough for Trident Luxury. 

I'll keep my overstock set aside for travelers like us. We work hard, we all deserve to kick back and relax with a glass of merlot. Hit me up at any of the colonies with terminals like these, or find me in Akila City and let's make a trade. My ship's called "Gravitas". Give me a ring if you see me in the spacelanes. I'm always down to share a bottle with a fellow traveler. 

Cheers! 

Omar

Hi everyone,

My name's Nadia, and I'd like to buy your old magazines! I'm looking for legacy editions of The New Atlantian that feature "Mickey Caviar's Taste of Space!". I'll take editorial columns, restaurant reviews, or recipes. They can be in any condition, as long as the text is readable.  

I'll accept credits or trades. My hull's always full, so name your price! You'll find me traveling between Bluebonnet, Nekoville, and Lucky Day.

Safe travels, and stay spicy!

Nadia

This public terminal is available for your use! 

All entries made here will be visible to other travelers who come through the colony. If you have extra goods to sell or warnings to offer other merchants, please feel free to enter them here. 

Several colonies throughout the Settled Systems are participating in this program. Our goal is to make the spacelanes a safer for traveling merchants, and give you all a way to stay in touch. Please spread the word at any new colonies you encounter! 

Good luck out there!

Your friends at the colony of Lucky Day

Hey, travelers,

My name's Luna. I paint landscapes for Paradiso resorts. I'm in kind of a pickle, hopefully someone here can help me out. 

I lost my sketchbook! It disappeared somewhere between Cydonia and here. I've turned my ship upside down and haven't found it anywhere. If you come across it, please hold onto it and leave me a message on one of these terminals! If I get it back in one piece, I'll paint you something as a thank you. 

Safe travels!

Luna Wright

Hey galaxy, the name's Decland Rhoads. I'm about to set off on a solo journey into uncharted space. The Settled Systems has gotten a little small for my taste. It's time we see what else is out there.  

I'm leaving this message as a record of my location, in case I don't make it back. My parents' names are Jess and Michael Rhoads. They live in New Atlantis, in Athena Tower. 

My plan is to be back two years from the date of this message. If and when I return, I'll delete this message. Should the worst happen, I'd be obliged if someone could let my parents know that this is the last place I was seen. Fingers crossed that it won't come to that. 

Make your way,

Decland

Tip for all travelers in the area. If you're hailed by a friendly ship captained by an old woman, do yourself a favor and stop for her! She invited me for dinner, and we had a wonderful conversation. Plus, she makes some of the best food this side of the Brown Horse Tavern. By the end of the evening, she was packing my ship full of leftovers and asking me to call her "Granny". It was just what I needed after months in the spacelanes. Keep your eyes peeled for her!

Hello traveling merchants,

The name's Jio Osaka. I'm a merchant who specializes in organic goods. I've been having trouble running my route lately thanks to the growing number of spacers in this area. To combat this, I've founded a merchant group. Safety in numbers, right? 

A few other vendors who travel this part of the spacelanes are already on board. Omar Nevin, Aura Shelby, and Julie Fearth (you probably know her as Jumping Jules) have committed to traveling together. All are great pilots, and fantastic company. Come and join us! 

See you soon,

Jio
